Liriosma species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where they thrive in moist, shaded environments. They typically have heart-shaped leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
